meta_description: The Upcountry History Museum - Greenville County, through its collections, programs and exhibitions, preserves and interprets historical subjects pertaining to the Upcountry of South Carolina while bringing museum-quality offerings from around the world to the Upcountry.
hours_text:
### **Operating Hours**

Tuesday-Saturday: 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Sunday: 1:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Monday: Closed

**Holiday Closings**  
Christmas Eve, Christmas Day, New Year’s Eve, New Year’s Day, Thanksgiving Day and 4th of July

### 

### **Admission Rate**

**$14** Adults

**$13** Senior adults (ages 65 and up) and college students with valid ID

**$10** Children age 3 to 18

**FREE** Children age 2 and under

_(All tickets are non-refundable.)_

### **[](https://emuseum.upcountryhistory.org/generaladmission.aspx)**

### 

### **Food, Beverage and Bag Policy**

The Pepsi Lounge on the 1st floor houses vending machines that offer a variety of snacks and refreshments. You may bring in outside snacks and beverages (in sealed containers), but we ask that you please keep all food and drink inside the Pepsi Lounge. Unless there is a special program, open beverages and food are not allowed in any UHM galleries.

Large bags and backpacks can damage artifacts and artwork. We ask that you please leave your bag in the cubby storage area near the front desk. If you must carry your bag, it needs to be kept by your side. Nothing is permitted to be carried on one’s back, including backpacks, drawstring bags, and purses.

### 

### **Discounts Available**

accessibility_text:
## _Making all visitors feel welcome_

### **The Upcountry History Museum strives to make all visitors feel welcome. Some accessibility features include:**

  * ### **Accessible facilities** and main entrance that is accessible to visitors with limited mobility.

  * ### Free manual **wheelchair loans** on a first-come, first-served basis. Visitors are welcome to use their own mobility devices.

  * ### **Open captioning** of the Museum’s orientation film and exhibition videos that are incorporated into changing exhibitions.

  * ### **Assisted devices** for the visually impaired (magnifiers) are available upon request at the Museum’s front desk.

[](http://www.upcountryhistory.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/Dana-Quote-Access-1.png)
